title: Messi names favorite goals of his career
body_text:
Sport
Messi names favorite goals of his career
Inter Miami captain, Lionel Messi has named his goals in the Champions League and World Cup finals to be among his favorites in his glittering career so far.
Messi recently picked up his eighth Ballon d’Or for his World Cup triumph with Argentina last December.
The Argentina captain beat the likes of Manchester City’s Erling Haaland and Paris Saint-Germain’s Kylian Mbappe to win the award.
In a conversation with France Football, Messi was asked to reveal his favorite goal from his 800 plus career goals.
The veteran forward said: “Well, I always say that special goals are the important thing to have scored in the Champions League final, to have now scored in the final of the World Cup.”
He added, “I don’t know, a goal that I always remember and I don’t go much for the goal and for what the goals mean.
“It’s the goal against Real Madrid, which we beat 2-0 in that Champions League semi-final in the Bernabeu. The most significant goals are the more important ones.”
